abstract: US Airways Group said Monday that it has enlisted Morgan Stanley to join Citigroup in providing the financing for its hostile $8.5 billion bid for Delta Air Lines. US Airways, which made its unsolicited bid for Delta in November, said at the time that it had tapped Citigroup for a $7.2 billion debt package intended to provide the cash portion of its offer as well as to refinance the merged company. Delta management strongly opposes the bid, seeking instead to exit bankruptcy as a stand-alone company.
lead_paragraph: US Airways Group said Monday that it has enlisted Morgan Stanley to join Citigroup in providing the financing for its hostile $8.5 billion bid for Delta Air Lines. US Airways, which made its unsolicited bid for Delta in November, said at the time that it had tapped Citigroup for a $7.2 billion debt package intended to provide the cash portion of its offer as well as to refinance the merged company. Delta management strongly opposes the bid, seeking instead to exit bankruptcy as a stand-alone company.

headline.main: Morgan Stanley Gets on Board US Airways Bid
